summary.p: The invitation of Bullinger and the others to a meeting in Urdorf [Canton Zurich] pleased him; he cannot interrupt his spa treatment, but afterwards - he has also informed his relative Hans Peter Wellenberg of this - he will come to Zurich together with some fellow spa-goers.

div.p: The grace of our dear Father in heaven be with us all.

Kind, dear lord and brother, I have received your and the other beloved lords' letter, in which you invite me to Urdorf out of special love, and I am rightly delighted by it, as I have always felt your friendliness and goodwill towards me (as indeed always before), for which I thank you sincerely and diligently, offering to earn such from you without reservation. And I inform you and the other lords that it is not possible for me to come to Urdorf on the appointed or any other day because I must attend to my spa treatment and wait for its completion. However, I do not want to hide my good intention from you, that I am willing to travel to Zurich together with some of my fellow spa-goers (spa companions). If this happens (as we have also informed our cousin Hans Peter Wellenberg of the same intention), I will gladly comply with your wishes. Therefore, I kindly ask you not to take offense at this refusal. It shall be more convenient for us, God willing, in Zurich than in Urdorf. With this, I commend myself to your prayers, which I earnestly desire from the heart.
Dated in Baden, Tuesday, the 17th of July in the year 1537.
Conrad Zwick, your very willing servant.
To the honorable and highly learned lord Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich, my particularly kind lord and friend.
